idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: The dataset depicts the authoritative boundaries of the most commonly known Department of Defense (DoD) sites, installations, ranges, and training areas in the United States and Territories. These sites encompass land which is federally owned or otherwise managed. This dataset was created from source data provided by the four Military Service Component headquarters and was compiled by the Defense Installation Spatial Data Infrastructure (DISDI) Program within the Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of Defense for Installations and Environment, Business Enterprise Integration Directorate. Sites were selected from the 2010 Base Structure Report (BSR), a summary of the DoD Real Property Inventory. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. For inventory purposes, installations are comprised of sites, where a site is defined as a specific geographic location of federally owned or managed land and is assigned to military installation. DoD installations are commonly referred to as a base, camp, post, station, yard, center, homeport facility for any ship, or other activity under the jurisdiction, custody, control of the DoD.
descript.purpose: This geospatial dataset contains authoritative boundary locations of Department of Defense sites, commonly referred to as installations, ranges, and training areas. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. Additionally, some sites were not included because geospatial data were not available, or it is a leased site. The point and boundary location data in this dataset are intended for planning purposes only, and do not represent the legal or surveyed land parcel boundaries.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of Defense for Installations and Environment, Business Enterprise Integration Directorate

idinfo.accconst: Although these data have been provided by each Service Component, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed in the use of these data.
idinfo.useconst: While every attempt has been made to provide the best available data quality, this data set is intended for use at mapping scales between 1:50,000 and 1:3,000,000. For this reason, boundaries in this dataset may not perfectly align with DoD site boundaries depicted in other federal sources. Maps produced at a scale of 1:50,000 or larger which otherwise comply with National Map Accuracy Standards will remain compliant if this data is incorporated. The point and boundary location data in this dataset are intended for planning purposes only, and do not represent the legal or surveyed land parcel boundaries.

secinfo.sechandl: This data was accessed by the user at geodata.gov. Although these data have been provided by the DoD Components, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on any other system, in derived products or data alterations, nor shall the act of distribution constitute and such warranty.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The dataset depicts the authoritative boundaries of the most commonly known Department of Defense (DoD) sites, installations, ranges, and training areas in the United States and Territories. These sites encompass land which is federally owned or otherwise managed. This dataset was created from source data provided by the four Military Service Component headquarters and was compiled by the Defense Installation Spatial Data Infrastructure (DISDI) Program within the Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of Defense for Installations and Environment, Business Enterprise Integration Directorate. Sites were selected from the 2010 Base Structure Report (BSR), a summary of the DoD Real Property Inventory. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. For inventory purposes, installations are comprised of sites, where a site is defined as a specific geographic location of federally owned or managed land and is assigned to military installation. DoD installations are commonly referred to as a base, camp, post, station, yard, center, homeport facility for any ship, or other activity under the jurisdiction, custody, control of the DoD.

Consts.useLimit: Preferred use citation: "This data was accessed by the user at geodata.gov. Although these data have been provided by the DoD Components, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on any other system, in derived products or data alterations, nor shall the act of distribution constitute and such warranty."

While every attempt has been made to provide the best available data quality, this data set is intended for use at mapping scales between 1:50,000 and 1:3,000,000. For this reason, boundaries in this dataset may not perfectly align with DoD site boundaries depicted in other federal sources. Maps produced at a scale of 1:50,000 or larger which otherwise comply with National Map Accuracy Standards will remain compliant if this data is incorporated. The point and boundary location data in this dataset are intended for planning purposes only, and do not represent the legal or surveyed land parcel boundaries.

stdorder.ordering: One .zip file is available for download. The contents include 2 Shapefiles (1 site point file) (1 site boundary file), ISO compliant metadata, and Data Release Notes.

procstep.procdesc:
This geospatial dataset contains authoritative boundaries of Department of Defense sites, commonly referred to as installations, ranges, and training areas. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. Additionally, some sites were not included because geospatial data were not available, or it is a leased site.
Final selection and approval of sites were coordinated and approved by each of the Army, Air Force, Navy and Marine Corps headquarters programs for installation geospatial information and services (IGI&S). Each IGI&S program coordinated review and approval with their respective real property officers to the greatest practical extent.
Installation data provided by the Service IGI&S programs depict the general location of installations, sites, ranges, and other areas managed by DoD as reported in the Federal Real Property Profile. The point and boundary location data in this dataset are intended for planning purposes only, and do not represent the legal or surveyed land parcel boundaries. Users may note positional inaccuracies in the boundaries when zooming to specific site locations, particularly where zoomed in beyond the recommended scale.
The initial raw data set was aggregated from several key DoD site location data sources by the DISDI Program and provided to each Service component for review. The Service IGI&S Programs coordinated with support teams to review the data, confirm site location information, and provide corrections. All feedback received from the Services was incorporated into the final database.
This dataset represents the baseline for georeferenced boundaries of sites in the Base Structure Report. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities. The Department has an ongoing effort to refine its site location data and intends to incorporate improvements in future annual releases.

dataqual.complete: This dataset represents the baseline for georeferenced boundaries of sites in the Base Structure Report. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities. The Department has an ongoing effort to refine its site location data and intends to incorporate improvements in future annual releases.

For this reason, boundaries in this dataset may not perfectly align with DoD site boundaries depicted in other federal sources. Maps produced at a scale of 1:50,000 or larger which otherwise comply with National Map Accuracy Standards will remain compliant if this data is incorporated. The point and boundary location data in this dataset are intended for planning purposes only, and do not represent the legal or surveyed land parcel boundaries.

dataLineage.statement:
This geospatial dataset contains authoritative boundaries of Department of Defense sites, commonly referred to as installations, ranges, and training areas. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities, and only those in the fifty United States and US Territories were considered for inclusion. Additionally, some sites were not included because geospatial data were not available, or it is a leased site.
Final selection and approval of sites were coordinated and approved by each of the Army, Air Force, Navy and Marine Corps headquarters programs for installation geospatial information and services (IGI&S). Each IGI&S program coordinated review and approval with their respective real property officers to the greatest practical extent.
Installation data provided by the Service IGI&S programs depict the general location of installations, sites, ranges, and other areas managed by DoD as reported in the Federal Real Property Profile. The point and boundary location data in this dataset are intended for planning purposes only, and do not represent the legal or surveyed land parcel boundaries. Users may note positional inaccuracies in the boundaries when zooming to specific site locations, particularly where zoomed in beyond the recommended scale.
The initial raw data set was aggregated from several key DoD site location data sources by the DISDI Program and provided to each Service component for review. The Service IGI&S Programs coordinated with support teams to review the data, confirm site location information, and provide corrections. All feedback received from the Services was incorporated into the final database.
This dataset represents the baseline for georeferenced boundaries of sites in the Base Structure Report. This list does not necessarily represent a comprehensive collection of all Department of Defense facilities. The Department has an ongoing effort to refine its site location data and intends to incorporate improvements in future annual releases.
